benchmark_details.name: Cooling Matters: Benchmarking Large Language Models and Vision-Language Models on Liquid-Cooled Versus Air-Cooled H100 GPU Systems
benchmark_details.overview: This study benchmarks large language models (LLMs) and vision-language models (VLMs) on liquid-cooled and air-cooled H100 GPU systems, evaluating performance, thermal efficiency, and power consumption.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To empirically compare liquid-cooled and air-cooled GPU systems for efficient power management and thermal performance in AI workloads.

data.source: Performance and thermal metrics from benchmarking studies of LLMs and VLMs on H100 GPU systems.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on real-time monitoring using various tools like ipmitool, GPU Burn, and Weights & Biases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher TFLOPS per GPU and lower temperatures indicate better performance and efficiency under heavy workloads.
methodology.baseline_results: Liquid-cooled systems achieved 54 TFLOPs/GPU compared to 46 TFLOPs/GPU for air-cooled systems during benchmarking.
methodology.validation: Thermal and power measurements were compared across both cooling systems under identical workloads.
